snippet: The $3 billion highway network has fallen into disrepair and come under insurgent control.
abstract: Afghan officials report Taliban insurgents have cut off access along main highway of national Ring Road in Baghlan Province, one of many problems that have besieged country’s busiest stretches of highway; road cost $3 billion to construct but has fallen under disrepair during insurgency.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jawad Sukhanyar in Kabul; Najim Rahim in Mazar-i-Sharif, Afghanistan; Taimoor Shah in Kandahar, Afghanistan; Farooq Jan Mangal in Khost, Afghanistan; and Khalid Alokozai in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The $3 billion highway network has fallen into disrepair and come under insurgent control.

headline.main: Taliban Cut Off Afghan Highway Linking Kabul to Northern Gateways
headline.print_headline: Taliban Cut Off Major Afghan Highway Linking Kabul to Northern Gateways

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction
